meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunder began to brey loudly in the distance.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine started to brey noisily.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to brey like a lion but sounded funny instead.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock seemed to brey like a trumpet in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the trees brey like a chorus of horns.

meanings.sent1: The brey of the horn startled the birds in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The brey of the donkey echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The brey of the baby made everyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The brey of the siren pierced through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The brey of the thunder shook the windows of the house.
